CustomerGroupServiceInterface

Extends

Defines constants and required methods for customer groups.

The constants for customer groups define the default group ID, the maximum number of groups, and the maximum number of characters in a group name.

The methods for customer groups enable users to:

  • Add, update, list, and delete groups.
  • Find groups that match specified search criteria.
  • Get the default group in a store, the delete status for a group, and group details.
package

Default

Methods

Lists groups.

getGroups(boolean $includeNotLoggedIn = true, integer $taxClassId = null) : array<mixed,\Magento\Customer\Service\V1\Data\CustomerGroup>

Use the $includeNotLoggedIn parameter to exclude the default group from the group list. Use the $taxClassId parameter to filter the group list by a specified tax class.

Arguments

$includeNotLoggedIn

boolean

(Optional) Set to true to exclude the NOT_LOGGED_IN group from the group list. Default is true.

$taxClassId

integer

(Optional) The ID of the tax class. Default is null.

Response

array<mixed,\Magento\Customer\Service\V1\Data\CustomerGroup>

Group list.

Searches groups.

searchGroups(\Magento\Framework\Service\V1\Data\SearchCriteria $searchCriteria) : \Magento\Customer\Service\V1\Data\SearchResults
throws

If there is a problem with the input

Arguments

$searchCriteria

\Magento\Framework\Service\V1\Data\SearchCriteria

Response

\Magento\Customer\Service\V1\Data\SearchResults

containing Data\CustomerGroup objects

Gets a customer group by group ID.

throws

If $groupId is not found

Arguments

$groupId

integer

Response

\Magento\Customer\Service\V1\Data\CustomerGroup

Gets the default group.

getDefaultGroup(integer $storeId = null) : \Magento\Customer\Service\V1\Data\CustomerGroup
throws

If default group for $storeId is not found

Arguments

$storeId

integer

Defaults the current store

Response

\Magento\Customer\Service\V1\Data\CustomerGroup

Determines whether a specified group can be deleted.

canDelete(integer $groupId) : boolean
throws

If group is not found

Arguments

$groupId

integer

Response

boolean

True, if this group can be deleted

Saves a specified group.

saveGroup(\Magento\Customer\Service\V1\Data\CustomerGroup $group) : integer
throws

If there is a problem with the input

If a group ID is sent but the group does not exist

If saving customer group with customer group code that is used by an existing customer group

If something goes wrong during save

Arguments

$group

\Magento\Customer\Service\V1\Data\CustomerGroup

Response

integer

customer group ID

Deletes a specified group.

deleteGroup(integer $groupId) : boolean
throws

If $groupId is not found

Thrown if cannot delete group

If something goes wrong during delete

Arguments

$groupId

integer

Response

boolean

True if the group was deleted
